purpose: Deep behavioral analysis, work style assessment, and team fit prediction

candidate_persona_profiling.purpose: Create psychological and behavioral profile from resume and communication patterns

career_archetype.purpose: Identify candidate's primary career driver and motivations

signals: Founded or early employee at startups
Uses words like: architected, designed, created, launched
builder_creator.best_fit: Startups, new initiatives, innovation labs, R&D roles
builder_creator.red_flags: Large bureaucratic orgs, maintenance roles, strict processes
builder_creator.interview_focus: Ask about their proudest creation, how they handle ambiguity
builder_creator.retention_strategy: Give them greenfield projects, autonomy, visibility

signals: Uses words like: optimized, reduced, improved, fixed, migrated
optimizer_fixer.best_fit: Scale-ups needing optimization, legacy modernization, operational roles
optimizer_fixer.red_flags: Greenfield projects with no constraints, pure research roles
optimizer_fixer.interview_focus: Ask about their biggest efficiency win, how they identify bottlenecks
optimizer_fixer.retention_strategy: Show them systems that need improvement, celebrate wins publicly

signals: Long tenure focused on specific technology
Conference speaker, blog writer, open source contributor in niche
Uses words like: specialized, expert in, certified, mastered
specialist_expert.best_fit: Architecture roles, subject matter expert positions, technical leadership
specialist_expert.red_flags: Full-stack generalist roles, constant technology switching
specialist_expert.interview_focus: Go deep on their expertise, ask about edge cases and advanced scenarios
specialist_expert.retention_strategy: Give them complex technical challenges, speaking opportunities, mentorship roles

signals: Uses words like: led, managed, mentored, collaborated, aligned
leader_multiplier.best_fit: Management track, tech lead roles, team building scenarios
leader_multiplier.red_flags: Pure IC roles with no collaboration, isolated work
leader_multiplier.interview_focus: Ask about leadership philosophy, conflict resolution, team building
leader_multiplier.retention_strategy: Clear path to management, leadership training, team ownership

signals: Uses words like: learned, explored, adopted, experimented
explorer_learner.best_fit: Innovation teams, consulting, roles with tech diversity
explorer_learner.red_flags: Maintenance of legacy systems, single-tech environments
explorer_learner.interview_focus: Ask about learning style, most exciting new tech, how they stay current
explorer_learner.retention_strategy: Rotation programs, conference attendance, learning budgets

signals: Uses words like: maintained, ensured, secured, documented, standardized
stabilizer_guardian.best_fit: Enterprise, operations, SRE, security, compliance roles
stabilizer_guardian.red_flags: Fast-moving startups, move fast and break things culture
stabilizer_guardian.interview_focus: Ask about handling critical incidents, risk management, documentation practices
stabilizer_guardian.retention_strategy: Emphasize stability, quality focus, give them guardian roles

work_style_assessment.purpose: Predict how candidate prefers to work

independent_operator.fit: Best for: Remote roles, individual contributor positions, minimal supervision
independent_operator.risk: May struggle with: Micromanagement, excessive meetings, collaborative environments

collaborative_teammate.fit: Best for: Agile teams, open offices, pair programming cultures
collaborative_teammate.risk: May struggle with: Isolated remote work, solo projects

sprinter.fit: Best for: Startups, fast-moving teams, competitive markets
sprinter.risk: May struggle with: Slow-moving enterprises, long planning cycles

marathoner.fit: Best for: Enterprise, complex systems, regulated industries
marathoner.risk: May struggle with: Constant pivots, move fast and break things

specialist.signals: Deep in one or two technologies, certifications, expertise claims
specialist.fit: Best for: Technical leadership, architecture, specialist roles
specialist.risk: May lack breadth for full-stack or generalist roles

generalist.signals: Wide range of technologies, full-stack mentions, diverse projects
generalist.fit: Best for: Startups, small teams, full-stack roles
generalist.risk: May lack depth for specialist or expert positions

servant_leader.fit: Best for: Growing teams, modern tech cultures

visionary_strategist.fit: Best for: Senior leadership, transformation roles
visionary_strategist.indication: Think big picture, may need support for tactical execution

communication_style.purpose: Assess how candidate communicates based on resume writing style

high_detail.signals: Lengthy descriptions, specific metrics, comprehensive explanations
high_detail.weakness: May over-communicate, struggle with concise updates

concise.signals: Brief bullet points, key highlights only, minimal fluff
concise.weakness: May under-explain, need to probe for details

outcome_focused.signals: Every bullet has metrics, outcomes, business impact
outcome_focused.fit: Great for client-facing, leadership, business-critical roles

process_focused.fit: Great for operations, process improvement, compliance roles

cultural_fit_analysis.purpose: Predict how well candidate will mesh with company culture

required_traits: Comfort with ambiguity and rapid change

signals_in_resume: Grew with a company (Series A to C)

red_flags: Fast-paced, move fast and break things attitude

success_indicators: Experience with both remote and office

assess.team_size_comfort: Check if candidate has worked with similar team sizes
assess.reporting_structure: IC vs manager track, layers of hierarchy
assess.technical_diversity: Uniform tech stack vs polyglot environment

questions_to_validate: You've worked on teams of X size. This team is Y size. How do you feel about that?
This role involves [collaboration level]. Walk me through how you'd approach that.
The team uses [specific methodology]. Have you worked this way before?
